attributes.text: This hotel has good beds and quick internet connection and the things you need as a business traveller. Its located in the centre of Wroclaw, and many things are within walking distance. Despite being located out to a fairly large road, you hardly hear the cars inside the hotel. Breakfast is good and plentyful.

Hotel is nice, lifts took a while to get the hang of. Its popular with large groups, so be warned that if one of these large groups arrive you could be hanging around for breakfast a while Staff were friendly enough and had no issues getting served in bar or restaurant

Great location with tram stop outside the door. Excellent breakfast, including a fruit press to make your own fresh fruit juice. Comfy beds. Friendly staff throughout the hotel. There was a limited choice for dinner menu, but the quality was good.

We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. Everything was well arranged (extra bed for our 5 years old daughter). The room was not too spacious but ok. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Hotel restaurant is remarkable, the breakfast was great (you can "brew" your own juices). 15 min walk to the city center. Would recommend the hotel.

Nice hotel, good location near main railway and bus stations, few trade centers around. My room was clean and comfortable, with big TVset, and shower. Breakfast was quite OK, good selection of dishes. The staff was friendly.

Stayed 4 nights in 2 adjoining rooms, 2 adults and 2 children. Very comfortable beds. The hotel is located very centrally within a short walk of the centre and train station. The breakfast was amazing and kept us going for the day ahead.

I don’t find the location great. There wasn’t anything nearby. The breakfast was average and the size of the room small’ish. Very basic and minimal amenities We had the set dinner with the tour group at the café restaurant. The food and service were good.

Great value for money. Super clean and comfy. Breakfast is amazing!! Friendly helpful staff, would definitely recommend for business or pleasure. Very convenient if heading to centre as about a 20 minute walk. Some good small bars near by too

Great hotel rooms are lovely bathrooms are so clean with all the extras you need . Lovely food and great prices . Great location . Staff are so lovely . So near to the shopping malls . Sky tower is just down the road . Trams are right outside into the centre. Enjoy

Hotel is very new and modern, situated within walking distance to city centre. Hotels conference facilities excellent and uses modern technology which was quite impressive, snacks between breaks were provided and delicious. Hotels restaurant offers good breakfast and also great dining options for lunch and dinner. Really enjoyed the view of the snow too from the full size windows. Highly recommend for businesss and personal stay.

Quite a nice room however very noisy. The windows hardy isolate cars and trams’ sounds. May wake you up at night. I was not able to connect my notebook to tv to which my movies (HDMI cable was required, was not available in reception, no WiFi connection to the TV set).

Nice hotel, rooms are very clean with shower. Hotel is near the town center and shop center. Breakfast and restaurant are good. Ask for a room on back side because a little bit noisy in the frond but acceptable.

Stayed here first week in November The Hotel is central location 10 min walk to the town square in one direction and a 2 min walk from a shopping mall in the opposite direction. The hotel has lovely rooms and are well maintained. Buffet Breakfast with a great variety of food and the restaurant lunch and dinner was also great.

The Q is a very nice modern hotel in central Wroclaw. The room features all the modern touche you could ask for. Adjusting the room temperature was a mystery. The room was medium to large and the bathroom was fairly large. It had a walk-in shower instead of the European extra tall risk life and limb getting in and out of tub. also, as in most hoteles in Europe, you should bring your own washcloths.

Stayed here for 5 nights in September, room was spotlessly clean with Tea & Coffee making facilities but the room was constantly cold, air condition was noisy and impossible to control, bathroom was clean, shower was just OK. You have to use your room key to operate the lift which was fine going up, a different matter when you tried calling the lift to get down to reception, it was taking about a dozen attempts for the scanner to read your key card to enable you to call the lift. Breakfast was plentiful with plenty of choice although the could have done with a better toaster. Coffee was excellent. Staff were 1st class and hotel is in a fantastic location. Would I stay again, Yes probably

Staff very helpful, Hotel was very nice, in a good location. The restaurant was exceptional and breakfast a lot more than expected. So all in all in all a very good Hotel. The bit that was really nice was the attention to detail by the cleaning staff, and even when you would meet them they weee so professional. You really knew you were a respected guest. Thank you to all the staff.

Overall a nice hotel, only 1.5 km away from the city centre, with excellent breakfast. However, there were some shortcomings during our stay: 1. The safe and the TV set could only be used after contacting the room service. The member of staff sent to our room coped with these problems quickly, but did not make a friendly impression. 2. It was impossible to switch off the airconditioning in our room. It was running all the time. Only when opening the window it stopped working, which is not convenient at night due to the traffic passing by while the temperatures in the room were too chilly at times with the airconditioning system running. Contacting the hotel room service another time would have been an option, but due to the previous experience (see above), we decided against…

Stayed for 2 nights. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The check in was smooth and the staff welcoming. They even arranged a last minute tour to Auschwitz. The breakfast spread and quality was good. The location of the hotel let’s you walk to the city centre and is accessible by public transport. There is a supermarket located just 5 minutes from the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here if I visit Wroclaw again.

It's a very good and modern Hotel. The Staff is very friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very good with all you can desire. Free Wifi. It's possible to park in the streets near the hotel.

So the first impression of Poland and of this hotel were the two young ladies on reception who thought that taking the piss out of the guests who were checking in an appropriate way to act. Taking the passports showing them to one another and laughing their heads off ignoring the guests. If this were my hotel and they were my staff, they would NOT be dealing with the public again! The hotel was comfortable and the rooms were clean. The bar staff were very grumpy and it seemed as though we had annoyed them by asking for a drink. The only thing that let this hotel was the front of house staff who I would immediately ensure they have some compulsory retraining! The reception staff this morning were like a breath of fresh air, it was like we were in a different hotel, what a shame…

Centrally located in Wroclaw so that we can get around town easily on foot. Firm beds with two pillows on each so that we get a good night's sleep. Refrigerator does not work. Lights do work but room needed more. Bathroom with good towels and place for our toiletries though shower is only half covered with glass. Room is quiet at night even though tram tracks are below our windows. Very good breakfast buffet.

Nothing is amiss here. Hotel staff are courteous and efficient. Rooms are adequate in size with showers in each bath. Restaurant can use an upgrade in the breakfast time, especially the quality of coffee as it's pretty harsh flavor. But all in all, this is a decent hotel and literally right next to the tram line into the old town.

When I reflect back on my tour, I think of the comfy beds and pillows here..wow...super comfort for,a nice rest after exploring beautiful old town Wroclaw .Friendly and helpful staff and pleasant all around atmosphere . Good variety for breakfast as well. We enjoyed our stay, cute small rooms but with all the comforts.

Warmly recommend the hotel. Good value. Not in the center but public transport within 1 minute walk, to anywhere in the city for 3 ZLT. Walking distance to several shopping centers. A very good and varied breakfast, an option to take breakfast on the way, a welcoming staff and a quick response to every issue and problem. Service Manager / Reception A young and energetic man, he has time to sit, listen and take care of subjects and requests quietly and with a big smile ..

Don’t book if the forecast calls for warm weather; The A/C system in the rooms is totally inadequate. Open the window if you like streetcar noise all night. And, if you’re reading this in English, which you are, be aware there’s only one TV channel in your language, and it’s Bloomberg Euro, which is nothing more than a stock-ticker Service. Here’s a tip: when your own finger doesn’t summon the elevator touch panel, ask a bellhop...they seem to know just the right way to tap. And don’t be afraid to walk down a dimly lit corridor; sensors will (probably) turn on the lights for you.

This hotel is very clean and comfortable. Great value for money. The breakfast is especially good, you can take as much as you like. Just half an hour away from the airport and a few mins from the centre in a taxi. The staff are very friendly and speak English.

We had booked for three weeks, but due to unforeseen circumstances we had to fly home two weeks early. Patryk [--], front office manager, was amazing and highly professional. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff were friendly and efficient and our stay could not have been more pleasant. There was an impressive buffet breakfast and we ate dinner at the hotel one night, which was delicious. We will return and I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Wroclaw.

After cancelling my stay in another hotel, I moved to the Q-Hotel in the center of Breslau. I didn't regret this decission. Clean rooms, a very good breakfast, a good restaurant, friendly service, parking loft, gym and quite nights....

Overall the hotel is quite good but there is room for improvement. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The rooms are comfortable with a reasonable bath and breakfast options are excellent. There is room for improvement in cleanliness. Rooms should be more thoroughly cleaned between guests as there were more hairs here and there than there should be and whatever vacuuming occurred while I was there didn't get the carpet clean. The carpets in the hall on my floor could have used some spot cleaning. The fitness center equipment is awful and in need of replacement. This last item resulted in my staying at another hotel on my next visit.

I stayed in Q Hotel for two nights on business and there is nothing I would complain about. Well, maybe the check-out process could have been a little faster, but it was still acceptable. Reasonably priced, modern, clean, quiet rooms, comfy bed, good breakfast, helpful staff... worth booking.

The rooms were clean, modern, and comfortable. The staff was terrific - super friendly! Most spoke very good English and were eager to help with questions about places to see, eat, etc. The breakfast buffet was really good. Underground parking is available, but spots are limited and access is a bit tricky for anything larger than a compact. The location was nice - outside of the bustling downtown, but an easy walking distance.

A beautiful hotel set close to the city centre .... Neatly decorated yet simple lobby very pleasant. Stayed for 2 nights in business and found everything just perfect from check in to breakfast and room service including the final good bye. Polite, pleasant and extremely helpful staff and appreciate how accomodating they are when it comes to ensuring a guest is well taken care of. Breakfast was sumptuous with a wide spread of continental as well as local produce with plenty of choices for veggies as well. The only thing that I would recommend the management to take up is also prepare introduce some more spicy types of scrambled or masala omelettes made to order on request. Though they tried to make one I would not recommend anyone to go for it ... Probably need some help in…

Environment is very good. Location is near city center. And hotel services are good. Staff is friendly. But toiletries were not enough. I think they need to look on it. Above all very satisfied with the stay.

This hotel is very clean and nice, breakfast buffet is fantastic as well, the only downside is how far away the hotel is from the city center (it is about 20 minutes walk. Rooms are fare sizes and beds are great and cleaning and people at the front desk are fantastic.

Great hotel , comfy beds , good food and great big shots of vodka USB plugs , good shower, bed was so comfy I slept for 8 hours Would advise any one to try this hotel !! Il be going back for sure , every time I go to Wroclaw!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Nice hotel in good location,unfortunately the bean counters are killing the goose that layed the golden egg. Examples. Our reservation was for 695 euros and they charged 711 euros! They don't turn the heat on. Our room was so dark because of the small light bulbs we could not read the newspaper. The prices in the restaurant were so high it was empty most of the time. And all the other little things that show up in a hotel that is squeezing costs!

I stayed for two nights and had a pleasant stay. However, I wouldn't rate it 4 stars, but rather 3 - 3.5. + fair prices + good location, close to the city centre + wonderful view (especially at sunset) from gym windows - only one person at check-in counter - restaurant closed at 10 pm although all printed hotel information said 11 pm - of the two elevators, one was permanently out-of-order

I was expecting much more from this hotel. On arrival I've noticed that mini bar was completely empty which is strange for 4* hotels. When tried to make coffee I've noticed no milk was available in the room . Also our room was way too small. On the good side bed was comfortable. We usually stay at Scandic when visiting Wroclaw and I'm the future we'll stick to them.

Very nice rooms (we had a twin room for families). Very clean, good location, good breakfast. I would say everything was ok with that place. Within a walking distance to old town. I can definitely recommend. One strange thing. empty mini bars and fridges not working at all...

Where do I start..... upon arrival our room is so tiny can't even get our 2 suitcases to fit anywhere in the room without banging into them! Believe me when we say cruise ship rooms are huge compared to these! What kind of joke was played on us! 4 star more likely maybe at best 2!!! Have had to call reception multiple times as we can't even get our TV to work without calling them! Be careful using the iron in the room ours sparked and caused the electric to go out and it took them over 20 minutes to respond even though we told them the iron caused a flash of sparks! The hotel is a real dive in US and European standards!! Extremely disappointed and can't wait to leave!!!!!!!!! The biggest dilemma is we are staying at a Q plus hotel in Krakow and now have our doubts that they will…

Do not go to this motel if you require wifi - it did not work at all for 5 of our 8 nights. Location is not in centre but public transport good. Good breakfast except that the coffee machines said filter needed changing all week. By end of week coffee was undrinkable.

The restaurant was closed before the hour written (22:00) We had to negotiate to get a salad. We had to negotiate to have a coffee at the end of our dinner. The man from the bar refused to serve us because he already have cleaned in coffee machine. The bar is supposed to close at 23:00 and it was 22:30. No parking place. Personel were very rude except the somellier snd the reception woman who were very kind.

Stayed here for 3 nights it's a very clean and modern hotel. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Hotel is in a good location tram stop outside hotel and a bike station near by . It is around 20 minutes away from market square . Shopping centre and other bars are also near to hotel. I would stay in this hotel again.

I can definitely recommend the Q Hotel Wrocław for a business stay. The hotel has nice and helpful staff, who quickly checked me in, helped arranging for the cab. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I was also satisfied with the breakfast - variety of choice and starts at 6:30, which is important if you have ealry morning meetings. I will defnietely come back.

not enough space in the hotel parking lot. which wa very inconvenient as we arrived late with a small child. so reserve early. otherwise just fine. breakfast average and hotel fridge not stacked with things.

This hotel is in a good location with easy access to sky tower and aekady/renoma shopping centres. I like the restaurant food but for many may find it limited in choice. Staff always friendly and professional. There's a tram stop outside so handy to go further afield Bedrooms are small but perfectly formed. Beds are super comfortable. Down duvet and feather pillows.

Very good hotel - room was clean and bed was comfortable. Helpful staff. Good breakfast. I would stay there again if i needed to. Location was very good, with only a 20 minute walk to get into the city centre.

Really nice hotel, located a little on a side (15-20 minute walk to the main square). Great choice at breakfast, rooms clean and functional. Internet OK, friendly staff. The only weak link is their garage: first it's rather compact area so if you have a big car think it over; second: if you want to get out from garage you need to call reception then the gate and the barrier open. I was unlucky - got out from garage after another car so the gate was open but barrier not. And then you have two options left: either you get out of your car and go to the reception or you go back to garage and call them again. Both solutions are embarassing (honking didn't work)

Our family of four stayed in family room - those are actually 2 joined rooms. The staff is very nice and helpful, but when we arrived there was only one person at reception desk and we had to wait longer to get our keys. The rooms are very nice although the beds are too soft.The breakfast is very good with large choice of foods. Parking is the weak spot: it is not very big and the car entrance requires some good driving skills to avoid scraching your car.

Stayed here on 11th July for 1 night. Was very hesitant about booking it after a really bad experience in its sister hotel in Gdansk (and an even more disappointing response from management to my complaints) .... however the Wracklow hotel is a completely different set-up from the Gdansk hotel . The hotel is obviously very efficiently managed and the staff were so friendly and helpful especially Magdalena on reception .... the hotel has a bright, modern foyer and bar area and the rooms are really lovely too with comfy beds . The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the main square but the tram runs from right across the street outside the front door . There is private parking at 40 zloty per night. A special find is on the walk from the hotel to the square is a street (off to the…

1. Only cold water in the shower. 2. No sleep because of the noise at 01:30 am caused by the stuff of the hotel, when moving tables in the conference room in the first floor, waking up the whole second floor of the hotel, than after complaining they stopped until 06:00 am when they started working there again. 3. The ramp in garage hit the back of my car because the photocell is installed in wrong position. 4. Waiting time in the restaurant for the waiter to bring the menus, 20 minutes was enough for us to leave. 5. Its not 4 star hotel any more, no way, 2 stars at most.

The rooms were nice. Location is good - easy walking to the town center. Parking in the secured garage is very, very tight, so don't head down there with a very big vehicle - you might not get out. I parked the second night on the street.

Enjoyed my stay a lot, the food was amazing, close to central nightlife location and most of the restaurants, friendly staff but a bit loud, very helpful, hospitable, they would get out of their way to help. Fun, I was happy

Nice modern hotel, not in Old Town, but convient to public transportation. Very close to Sky Tower. Nice towel warmer in bathroom, but no little bottle of shampoo, which seemed odd, and the only one of 5 hotel we stayed did did not have shampoo. We had dinner in hotel restaurant and it was delicious. A great mushroom soup and strawberry smoothie for dessert. Nice art work in dinning room.

I look forward to stay in Q Hotel Wroclaw again, and I would definitely recommend it to friends and colleagues. This is a modern new hotel in city centre, and close to places of interests, entertainment restaurants/cafes, and transport.

I was disappointed after visit in this hotel. Yes this is a new hotel but the service is not good enough. First of all I asked for a quiet room away from the street and I got one. The problem was that the all night there was banging of the metal sheet on the roof. The air condition in the room was broken. Still there was constant hum of the air condition units on the roof and the whistle of the wind in the air condition pipes. I also was hearing the noises from the corridor others quest shouting, looks like not every quest can behave correctly. Another problem was that the walls are not good enough as I was feeling the vibration of the door closing in the other rooms. Instead quite room I got total nightmare, so did not get good rest at all. The room was getting hot and…

Well located hotel situated about 15 to 20 minutes stroll from main town square. About 8 minutes walk to either the Sky tower and mall or the Arcady mall. Hotel is clean and well appointed. Free WiFi throughout but for some reason a little weaker on 3rd floor. Rooms are adequate and kept well presented. Beds were comfortable and extra pillows available on request. Shower gel provided in bathroom. If you require any personal items I.e. razor, shaving gel, even sanitary items, you can request at reception. Iron and ironing board provided in each room. Small gym on 7th floor...limited equipment but excellent views. Breakfast consisted of a varied selection of hot and cold dishes. You can request a takeaway packed breakfast which we did as one of us would not be eating at the…

Just back from a week stay at the Q hotel. Hotel is perfectly located between the sky tower and arkady, with a tram stop just outside. We checked in around 1am after a night flight, reception staff were friendly and efficient. Hotel and room all clean and well maintained. Breakfast is excellent with a good range of cold and hot food. Wi-fi is available throughout the hotel, but suffered a bit from around 10pm in my top floor room, slowing down quite a bit. The hotel have had the fantastic idea of putting a HDMI and USB socket next to the bed so my fire stick plugged straight in with no need to mess around with the back of the TV. All in all a good hotel.

Great hotel, lovely breakfast, clean, modern staff were very freindly and helpful and there is a tram stop outside the front door so easy access to the town centre - only 2 stops. Staff were very helpful and gave us a picnic breakfast for an early flight.

Super quiet room. Clean and generous. But the best is the food in the restaurant. It's just fabulous. Also the service was super friendly. We go again to have dinner there. We had salmon, seafood pasta and octopus carpaccio.

Stayed for 4 nights on a short break to visit the xmas markets. Nice modern hotel, 10 minute walk to the nearest shopping mall or 1 stop on the tram. A short walk the in the other direction to the sky tower. It's 20-30 minute walk to the town centre, Average size room with comfortable bed and small bathroom but very clean and well maintained. Didn't eat in the restaurant but plenty of other guests did. Reception staff very helpful as were the bar staff.

Hotel is very nice, clean and modern, value for money. Rooms are quite big, very comfortable bed, Staff is very friendly. Hotel is situated not far away from the old town, very close to the big shopping centre. I recommend this hotel for business travellers and tourists,

Stayed at the hotel during a conference that also took place there. Rooms were functional, clean and very well kept. Staff was helful and generally nice - only set back was the lack of language abilities and the following confusion but it was a minor issue. Restaurant actually quite good with 'new' Polish cooking.

A nice, modern, clean hotel, close to the center (10 min walk). Great breakfast, superb restaurant, big rooms. Very friendly and service-oriented staff. I tested several hotels in Wroclaw, but this is my favorite one!

The breakfast is fabulous! Fresh fruits, cereals, salads, breads, sweets and hot food is more than you need. 15-20 minute walk to the old city center or train station. Very clean and efficient rooms, adequately spacious. Underground parking is convenient. Great friendly and helpful staff.

Nice and clean hotel. Large rooms. Great breakfast. Though unfortunately badly designed as to necessity of parking a bus for the check in of the group.The staff does not seem to be helpful and accommodating while a bus groups arrives

Nice, modern, clean hotel with nice staff and good food. I would have given it a grade of 4 or 5 if it wasn't for the fact that the traffic was very loud and noisy in my room. I had to wear earplugs and was afraid of missing my flight because I wouldn't hear the alarm.

Rooms are very comfortable. Staff is very nice and helpful. You will get what are you pay for and even more. Restaurant is very good. Food is fresh made. Breakfasts are brilliant - full of choice, everything what you need.

Absolutely amazed by the place. Stayed for 3 nights. New hotel in town city (15 min walk to main square or you can take tram that can you take near city centre in few min time ) close to beautiful shopping centre. Hotel is located next to busy main street- but very quiet so it will not disturb your sleep. Comfy bed and clean and tidy with good shower bathroom. Delicious breakfast and yummy dinner that we had one night in. Chef choices and waiting staff made dinner worth to dine there. Friendly staff at the reception. Defo would recommend this place to stay and enjoy Wroclaw as not that pricy as other hotels in this area.

arrived here as a large group, well overdue for our check in (due to unforeseen roadworks) - at 2330 they hotel staff managed to check in and feed 120+ people with quality food, a glass of wine and minimum fuss! not an easy feat. the rooms were spacious and comfortable - there was a room safe, fridge, air con - that I couldn't manage to get cold enough despite putting it to the lowest temperature, and as a result had a couple of restless nights..... the bathroom was lovely - walk in shower with excellent water pressure. the breakfast was varied with hot and cold dishes, but it was the meals they served our whole group that were really lovely. the hotel was a bit of a walk to the centre, but had a shopping centre approx 500m from the entrance. I would definitely recommend this…

Just stayed one night here. The room was clean and comfortable. A bit on the small side had we been staying longer. The bathroom is fine. The air conditioner worked well. The staff are friendly and very helpful. Their knowledge of the local area is great. A huge plus is being right on the tram line. The hotel is a little out of the main tourist area so the tram works well. Breakfast was okay. Not exceptional - just what you would expect and perfectly adequate. My only complaint is a nasty smell from the bathroom - perhaps from a drain? With door shut the bedroom was fine. Something the maintenance team could look at. I'd be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone.

I stayed 10 nights in August 2016, finding it easily meet my needs: clean, comfortable, good location, nice helpful staff, good menu at very reasonable prices. The smart tv meant I could watch programs via YouTube with ease which was great as I don't speak Polish so the tv would have been useless. Wi-Fi in the room was fine for my phone using Facebook etc but not so good for streaming programmes on a tablet.

The hotel is about 10-15 minutes walking to the city center. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Nice staff. We did not try breakfast there. The heater did not work properly, it was tricky to control it. It might have been good to have an additional blanket.

This was a comfortable hotel near the city centre. There is a tram station opposite the hotel that takes you whenever you want and there are many trams going to the old town (3-4 stops). Otherwise, it is not an interesting area. The room was spacious (standard double room) with comfortable bed and pillows, and spotlessly clean. We had lunch at the restaurant. The staff were polite and they offered us a free appetizer. The food was of really good quality and the prices reasonable. The hotel is environmentally friendly.

Stayed here on numerous times for business. Hotel is a little walk (20 mins) from the main square and is comfortable and modern. Breakfast is good and the wifi OK, but in some rooms the performance is poor. For a short stay this hotel is more than adequate.

Maybe this sleek, modern hotel suits a younger clientele but it wasn’t to our liking. The building presents as a block of tinted glass on a main road. Although there is a large sign about two stories up on the outside, there is nothing at street level to indicate that it is a hotel and we walked straight past it when we came from the station, thinking it was another ubiquitous office block. It was only when we were scratching our heads and thinking that we would never find it that we glanced up and realised that it was our hotel. The ground floor is open plan with a reception/lobby area, a bar area and a restaurant area. On our first night we tried to get a table in the restaurant but it was impossible as it was full with large groups of people. The bar was busy and the…

The hotel is great. Very comfortable bed. Noise proof windows which is a plus. Close to Arkadia galeria if you want to do some shopping. But the most amazing is breakfast which I would give 6 stars! The only minus was that when we arrived I wanted to make some tea and when I boiled watter it was brown. Somebody has burned the cattle and nobody bother to replace it....

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel Nice clean room and well appointed The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Close to shops and walkable to the old town of Wroclaw, depending on your fitness (15-20 min). Trams stop outside for the less fit ! The food in the restaurant was fantastic , The only complaint was the food took an age to arrive, so we pre ordered the next meal which was delivered promptly on time.

I stayed at this hotel for one night a couple of weeks ago. this review will be brief, as I arrived late due to the flight times from the UK and I did not eat at the hotel during my stay. I can however confirm that the room was very comfortable and clean, with all the facilities that I expect from a modern hotel - tea and coffee, water, fridge, safe, etc. The location was great too, just a short walk to the market square and restaurants. I am staying here again for 3 nights in June and will give a more comprehensive review, but must finish by saying that there was nothing negative to note during my stay and I am looking forward to returning. I almost forgot to mention, A/C and opening windows!

This hotel is a short walk from the train station. Public transportation is located in front of the hotel. Old Town is about a 15 to 20 minute walk or a few minutes by tram. The hotel staff were friendly and the breakfast buffet was good. This is a non-smoking hotel which was great.

The hotel was new when i stayed there (03.2015). Facilities were brand new and very high quality, breakfast was very good with a lot of variety. The rooms are quiet, unless you open the window in the morning rush hour (the trum can be a bit noisy).

American tourist do not be turned off by the brand name. Best Western in Europe is not the same as in America. This hotels has the comforts and décor of a Hyatt, Full Bird Marriott, or Hilton hotel in the states. It offer an impressive breakfast buffet, great menu at night or room service if you prefer. Internet was good enough to stream movies. Beer at the bar is reasonable. Its 1/2 block to grocery/liqour store, a huge mall that has a wash and fold service on bottom floor (40euro to wash 2 weeks of clothes). There is a new residential skyscraper down the street that has another mall and high end places to eat. Underground parking is available, the staff would reserve a spot for me every night. The staff was also very friendly. I really like the top floor cardio room, new…

Hotel is well located and staff is helpful. Rooms are spacious and clean. Cleaning service is also good. What I liked the most was the fitness room at 7th floor with view on town through big window wall. Breakfast is wast in variety of different food. The negative was parking. Their parking garage was full and another option was in a garage approximately 5 minutes of walk and I had to pay extra for it. Another option was to park on street.

Hotel is nice and staff very helpful. If you like rowing exercise at 7th floor is gym with good equipment and nice view. Rooms are clean and spacious. Only thing I didn't like was parking. Their garage was full another option was 5 minutes walk (not funny when raining) and paid approximately10 EUR per day. But if I go to Wroclaw I will definitely choose this one.

Just stayed 1 night, but found this hotel of a very high standard. The restaurant has 'fine dining' and presents dishes very elegantly. I ordered a breakfast to take away, as I left early - and it was plentiful! Enough to keep me going for lunch as well.

IT is very new . Very Clean. Perfect hotel to stay for business. This is what you need. The bar and resto as well very decent. Breakfast very good . Big selection of products. Important to stay on high Floors as all łów Floors are laud. And This is for sure disadvantage of This place. I woke up at 5am due to traffic. And was sleeping from the quiet side. Almost impossible to call to reception. No one answers.

Best western Q Plus is a new hotel which is clean, good location (10 minutes walk to the center). Everything you would expect from a reasonably priced chain hotel. I also ate here, the menu is fairly limited and the food it fine. I had to leave pre 6:30 am (when breakfast starts) but the hotel did a pack up breakfast.

We were traveling as a choir and lived staying at this new and modern hotel. It was an easy walk to the city center and Cathedral Island. The walk will take you past many dwarfs and statutes along with places to stop for coffee or a drink...if needed. We found it a lovely walk each evening from the city center. The hotel staff were inviting and even allowed us to gather as a large group and drink vodka! The rooms are small and the beds low to the ground but overall a very pleasant stay. We loved that the staff came out to the sidewalk and waved as we drove away! Definitely one of our best of cities and hotels.

Brand new hotel with all amnieties and conveniance expected. Hotel is located 15 minutes walking distance from city center. In front of the hotel there is tram stop any you can be in 5-8 minutes in city center. But most important is friendly and proffesional service.

Short weekend stay, nice place with convenient location. Really good restaurant. Very good standard of quiet and clean rooms, as well as facilities avaliable. Short distance by tram or bus right to the hearth of town, also very good conection with motorways system. In general highly recomended.

We arrived late of a Saturday. We were checked in by a friendly receptionist that was very helpful. We found the bar staff quiet unfriendly. On our first night we literally had to ask were they going to serve us at that point 3 bar staff had severed approx 6 people that were there after we went to the bar. This was not a good start. The hotel states that it's 1.7km from the centre. We actually didn't find it this far as the hotel is located a complete straight walk to the centre so it's in a lovely quiet location. THE hotel is very modern rooms are on the small side but have everything that you could need. The room had a safe that was free of charge this really is a bonus. We didn't eat in the hotel as we found food to be quiet expensive compare to locations in the centre.…

The hotel was a surprising good option for families with children, and the option of interlinking rooms worked for us and our family of 4 young children (6 months, 4, 6 and 8 years). Rooms were modern and bright and to a very high standard and the breakfast option certainly worked for us. 10 minute easy walk to the main train station and 30 minutes (children speed walk) to the Rynek (Main Old Town Square) with Tram Options. Tram 2 is a great option to take a family to the Wroclaw Zoo and Aquarium (Aquarium is very good) - Very good visit in late December to visit the Wroclaw Christmas Market. One minor issue - we keep our kids active throughout the day, but in a hotel room, it would be good if there was one or two children's channels on the TV so Mum and Dad could relax for a…

This is a great hotel. The room was spacious, cosy, modern and impeccably clean. High speed free wifi in the room (in fact, in the whole hotel). The food was very good, dinner and superb breakfast. My stay could not have been better. The city centre is just a 10-minute nice walk away. I fully recommend it.

I stay for 3 nights, after the first night with no heat and sleeping in cold, i change the room after huge debates with the staff and .... surprise.. i received a room across the first one .. guess what.. no heat. The problem was that, when you start the heat it's working for a few minutes and then it's giving you cold air . The third night i was lucky because i ask the staff to send somebody ro check heat and, when i return to the room in the evening, it was warm but, after i enter the room and start tv and light, it start to spread cold air so i stopped the sistym to preserve the heat till morning So .... enjoy

After a long, delayed trip by train, bus, and then train again from Dresden, Germany, it was a real pleasure checking in at the Best Western Plus Q hotel in Wroclaw. The room was spacious, sparkling clean and quiet, and had very comfortable beds and lighting. The breakfast buffet was superb, and customer service at the front desk and restaurant was fantastic. The location was also great-- only a 10 minute walk north to the Rynek (Old Town Square) or east to the main train station or Polski bus depot. The hotel was a great value too.

A relatively new property. Staff was extremely cordial and efficient. Rooms are well maintained and appropriately sized. Had a bit of a problem with the TV but was resolved in a matter of minute.s. There is a restaurant on site that is quite good. I had a bit of a disagreement with kitchen staff about a soup, but it was quickly resolved. Non issue. Breakfast was crazy stupid with selections......and the eggs were awesome. The entire place literally sparkled. Will absolutely return. One note of criticism....this is a non smoking facility...which is fine. As most of these establihsments they make no accomodation for smokers other than "go outside"...outside was pretty sketchy. just a comment.

I spent two nights in this hotel. The room was spacious enough and very clean. Complementary water is available in the room. Big tv. My room was facing the main street, but I was not really bothered by street noise. The hotel is conveniently located on main road, some 15 minutes walk away from the main square. There is a tram stop just in front of the door in case you don't fancy the walk. The breakfast buffet was excellent. Staff was friendly and helpful. There's an ATM in the lobby, which can be very useful. I will probably visit Wroclaw regularly on business and I would be more than happy to return to this hotel.

Great modern hotel, near the town centre. Room are well equipped and spotless. The restaurant is very nice. The underground car park is very handy. Also, the reception staff were very helpful with booking taxis, giving directions, printing boarding cards etc. I happily recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for 4 nights. The double room we had was spacious, modern and clean. Couldn't fault it. WiFi in the room was excellent plus over the whole hotel. Hotel is 15 mins walk from town centre, with a local shopping mall a few minutes away. Staff on reception were brilliant, spoke Good English. They booked us taxis with a local taxi company called Taxi Daniel, which were great prices and friendly service, especially with Tomek. So thank you Best Western for making our stay effortless and relaxing.

This is a new hotel, located 15 min walk from Old Town Market Square. Facilities are new and clean. Rooms are a bit small for 4* hotel, but still ok. We've suffered quite a lot of problems with check in, internet and TV, but all of them were solved and compensated by room upgrade and voucher for dinner - very positive attitude. Restaurant is really excellent - breakfasts are one of the best I've ever seen in my life - all vegetables, marinates, selection of meat, cheese, fish, breads, cakes, plenty of fruits incl. raspberries, good coffee etc. Underground parking is small and very tight. Every time I was entering / exiting, I was scratching bottom of my car, even though it's Mercedes C-class, so it's not low suspended sport car.

Great hotel. Rooms were nice and clean and trendy. Fitness room opened 24/7 with a nice view. Staff was really friendly and helpful. Location just a short walk away from the city centre (15min), close to shopping centre. Trams stop basically in front of the hotel, so easy to access centre with public transport as well. Most suprising was the breakfast, so delicous and extremely various and rich. Have not had such a good breakfast even in 4-5* hotels. Loved it for sure!

Stayed at hotel for a family wedding. Nice hotel, 15 min walk to centre. Very modern, good service and nice drinks at the bar. Breakfast was really excellent, as good as i have seen in a long time. The rooms were clean and modern but the air conditioning was broken and it was 38 degrees C! I asked reception to look into fixing this for us but they didn't appear to do anything about this. This was the only disappointment. Would stay again.

Great stay in this nice hotel. Nice rooms, nice breakfast and close to the office where I had to go so very convenient. Large room, nice TV, good bathroom. Lost of choice for breakfast Cheap price for the quality, I would return there.

Very nice, modern and clean hotel. Few minutes walk from Sky Tower, and Arkady Galery, not too far from the Old Town. Street car terminal is just in front of the hotel. Even number rooms face the main street Powstańców Śląskich, I am not certain about the street noise, but the view will be definitely much better than the rooms with odd numbers facing some offices.

A nice modern hotel, situated on the edge of Wroclaw within easy walk of the nice old town (about 20mins walk). Hotel was clean, well equipped with all the normal items you would expect plus free WIFI and Fitness room. The staff were friendly and helpful..

Stayed here for one week for family wedding. From beginning to end the service was impeccable; the staff went out their way to ensure the wedding party and all the guests enjoyed the day to the full. The rooms were comfortable and food was of the highest standard. Guests who attended the wedding from various parts of world commented this was one of the best hotels they had stayed in. The location was excellent with easy access to the centre of the city on foot or by tram.

We didn't mind the location of this hotel, you can easily take the tram for $1 or walk in 15 minutes to the town square. There are 2 shopping malls within 5 minute walks from this hotel and some nice restaurants 7 minute walk away. The hotel itself was grand. A modern room with great A/C, comfy bed & nice bathroom. There is a nice bar as well in the lobby where you can sit inside or outside. Friendly staff, I think they could work a bit on guest inquiries, it was super complicated getting a taxi to the bus station but everyone was really nice.

We stayed at this hotel as part of a family vacation. The location is somewhat far from the tourist areas so we had to walk at least a km to get anywhere. The hotel is clean and scything is in good condition. The breakfast has a decent assortment, mostly fresh. Beds were comfortable enough and wifi is good for that part of the world. Probably a better hotel for business travelers.

stayed here as part of a group. within a moderate walking distance of the city center. hotel had a fantastic display for breakfast. modern hotel that really made the use of smaller rooms. everything was stored uniquely in the room. we loved that it was very quiet. staff was helpful and spoke English very well.

This is a lovely modern hotel with lovely food just a shame it's situated where it is, the rooms are very nice and the beds are lovely and comfy the hotel is spotless I'd definitely stay there again when visiting Wroclaw

we wher there on business with rather large and demanding group of musicians and on behalf of our group i would like to thank your staff for a memorable stay at your hotel ! we heve stayed in thousands of five star and five star plus and six ans seven star hotels, and your crew and staff and your restaurant really qualify with the best we have come accross in many many years. thank you and please forward our thanks and recommendation to each and every one that was working on the reception, bar, restaurant, kitchen, breakfast or room service ! they were all fantastic and friendly and efficient ! all the best from all of us from the Seven Kings, the GIpsy Kings Family and Carl Urasch !

We stayed at the hotel two month after it had been opened. Spacious, bright, modern. The service excellent. 20 minutes walk to the Old Town Market Square and the historical part of the city as well as the restaurants, pubs, and clubs. The yard rooms are quieter and the view is more cozy one. The street rooms do not offer much of a a beautiful panorama of the city except the Sky Tower (see the photo)

A warm welcome, nice good English speaking staff. Nice rooms, it is a hotel where the developers thought about the comfort of the customers. The doors are closing slowly, so not early wake up due to people that are leaving the hotel early. USB charge connections in the wall :D! The restaurant in the Hotel is perfect, nice staff again and quality food.

A warm welcome by reception staff who spoke very good English. Our corner room, with a great view of the area, was huge, clean and very comfortable, as was the bathroom. The hotel is in a terrific location from the 'old town'. A tram is just outside or one can walk...Parking is included in the room charge as is wifi. There is a charge for breakfast and there is also a very good restaurant and bar, which we used once. Hope to come back when we are next in Wroclaw. Thank you....

Great from every point of view. New, modern, excellent price to quality ratio, professional and helpful staff, great restaurant! Only bad note: it is not in the city center. What's more ? I definitely recommend it if you are in the area.

A contemporary designed hotel within walking distance from the center and with a tram stop just in front. The staff were super helpful and the room was big and tastefully designed. Breakfast was excellent, I would go back there anytime.

We stayed in the hotel with my husband and daughter on Apr - 5-8. The hotel has the underground parking, comfortable and clean rooms, quiet atmosphere, very responsive and friendly staff. Wi-fi in the room is fast, beds are comfortable. Bathroom is clean and fresh. I really cannot find anything to be not happy with. The location is not right in the city center, but it takes about 15 mins to get there. There are a few shopping centers near the hotel and the Sky Tower building (about 50-storeyed), which has a breathtaking view on Wroclaw from the top:). The restaurant offers delicious meals and drinks. If in Wroclaw in future, will certainly consider this hotel for staying.

A beautiful new hotel in walking distance of the center of Wroclaw, Nice big reception, big nice new rooms, nice safe parking in the backyard and a lovely Polish breakfast, can be recommended for the best.

Very high quality hotel for the price. Good staff, decent rooms, lovely breakfast, great general ambience. Parking a bit expensive and its a 10-15min walk to old town. Other than that , only positives and for not a lot of money.

Stayed for two nights on a business trip. Staff were friendly and helpful despite very late check in and very early check out !. Easy walk in to the centre and the old town square (approx 15 to 20 mins) just follow the same road all the way , easy. Good value too.

Our visit was amazing. The hotel is perfectly located within a short walk to Old Town Square. Everything is within walking distance of the hotel but the staff is quick to call you a cab if required. The hotel staff truly catered to our needs. Robert and his team at the restaurant were very friendly and helpful. They helped us to book the table for the New Year's Eve at their amazing restaurant at the very last minute. Breakfast was just great, the food was fresh and very well prepared. The room was clean and well taken care of. We enjoyed the modern style. We utilized the room service once. The service was prompt and to our liking. We will come back to Wroclaw again and will stay at the hotel.

Stayed at this hotel for 2 days very clean good location and good rate per night - going back for 5 days in March. Had concerns about going to Poland being black, although i did not see any person of colour I felt safe. Don't be scare to visit the weather was cold but no colder than England at the time of my visit hope this helps

I stayed at the Best Western hotel for 2 nights and I loved everything in there. The hotel is a brand new with all necessary equipments, rooms have got everything including small stuffs even an iron, nails, threads:)) very comfortable bed with a super comfortable mattress, etc... Also was amazed how good was the breakfast at the restaurant of the hotel, the food was fresh and delicious. I spent the New Year's Eve at the the same restaurant where they had New Years live concert with a nice dinner. The restaurant has got very friendly and pleasant staff will make you feel like at home. Thank you for hosting me the Best Western hotel! I ll definitely stay there again whenever Im in Wroclaw.

Very good hotel with a very helpful staff ! The hotel restaurant has a delicious food. Close to the center (10 min by walk to Rynek)! Highly recommend to stay at during visiting an amazing city Wroclaw!

I recently stayed in this hotel for four nights. The hotel was good value, clean, had everything we wanted, staff were helpful, restaraunt was beautiful and there were great bars near it. Wroclaw itself pleasantly surprised me. We booked it by accident instead of Warsaw but it worked out great. Fantastic Christmas markets and within driving distance of Auschwitz and Krakow which we did in one day. Overall can't recommend hotel and city highly enough especially this time of year!

New building in a good position , in ten - fifteen minutes it possible to reach the city center by walk. Good restourant with Possibility to eat some good Italian dishes as Spaghetti Carbonara . The only point against is the car parking is very small

Stopped here during a work trip, it's a lovely spotless and modern city hotel, breakfast was lovely, staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Near to the sky tower and about a 10 minute walk to the old town, some cool little local bars about two minute walk away under the railway arches. Would have like more time to explore, considering a return trip with the Mrs.

I visited Wroclaw in October 2014 with my mum and stayed at the Q Plus for 7 nights. It's location is perfectly placed, only a 5 minute stroll to the new Sky Tower (and shopping centre) and only a 5 minute stroll the other way to the Arkady and Renorma shopping centres. The tram stops right outside of the hotel making the Rynek (square) easily accessible with only a 5 minute tram ride (just get on the number 6 or 7). There are also 2 big indoor markets within a 5 minute walk so if you don't want to use public transport you don't have to. The hotel itself is very modern and extremely clean. Our room, 604, was on the 6th floor and overlooked the magnificent Sky Tower and the tram line. I was worried that the traffic noise would annoy me but the windows are very well glazed and…

Did not have a reservation as we weren't sure where we would end up. Great price for BW members. Nice thick towels & in room coffee decent. Only negative is the walk to Main Square took 25 mins. And that is where you want to be! Beautiful old buildings and lots of restaurants.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights last week and really enjoyed it. Very modern, open plan Lobby, Bar Restaurant all spotless,very friendly staff throughout hotel. Lovely rooms,tea coffee making facilities, ironing board ,iron, fab bathroom .Rooms very quite and beds very comfortably. Tram stop outside door, 2 stops to citycentre or walk to rynek in 15 minutes, Sky tower 5 minutes walk in opposite direction. Overall a lovely hotel,great food and a great location.....would highly recommend.

We stopped at the Best Western Plus Q in Wroclaw for one night and enjoyed our stay there. We were a family of 4 and they gave us 2 interconnecting rooms, which was a plus for us. Hotel and rooms are modern and clean, including the bathrooms, which also that had spacious walk-in showers. It must be mentioned that the hotel has its own restaurant serving fantastic quality food. We had lunch there when we arrived, but the quality of the food was so good that we ended up having dinner there as well. I'm a bit surprised that this restaurant isn't included in Trip Advisor. Strong and fast WiFi connection (free). Overall a very good stay and will return if/when returning to Wroclaw.

Stayed here for a week in June while visiting some friends. Very modern and well kept hotel, with very nice rooms and nice and firm beds. Had breakfast there once, which was nice but expensive for what it was so we found alternative arrangements. There were a few new building teething issues while we were there, but resolved with minimum fuss. Staff v friendly and hotel in great location for transport as there is a tram stop right outside the front door. This does make it quite noisy here if you feel the need to open a window, but to be expected in a city break! Would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in Wroclaw

Stayed for three nights on business. Breakfast was spot on. Hotel rooms not the largest but very comfortable, clean and in good repair. Value for money is exceptional. Various national Local papers was a nice touch. Bar area spacious and suitable for informal meetings. Location is great and taxi services are extremely good and cheap. Get yourself to the old town if you visit and there are plenty of places to eat.

Didn't stay here but used the restaurant for an evening snack and we were very impressed. The place was not busy and the service was a little slow but the food quality was excellent. I took the chicken option and my colleague ordered the duck, we were both impressed with the food and the ambience. I would consider staying here next time.

We were a group of 10 persons attending a meeting in Wroclaw. Via a Polish friend we had this hotel and restaurant recommended. The hotel has 4 well earned stars and is completely new since May 2014. Rooms are spacy, very clean, heating and AC as well as bathroom worked perfect. No noise during nights. Tramstop just outside the door to the city centre og you may prefer to walk 15 minutes. All staff speak good English and were very friendly and showed good humor. We had arranged a special Polish dinner the first evening and a typical Polish wedding dinner for the second evening. The result was just fantastic each evening with 3 main courses and 6 small dishes with special prepared and home made specialities. The dinner was presented by a seemingly proud cook who explained all…

hopefully i was in the back side , so no noise from the main Streets but it's Noisy in the corridor , you can understand the discussions of the people which walk in corridors in the nights...i thought that my door was opened; and if you want a parking place in the underground parking, you must be an excellent driver cause its so empty for the 20 parking places ( average) and to go in and out , its so narrow ; dont go with a long and large car ...some cars have hit the metal pile and the wall at the corner; of course we can use the outside parking situated on the other side of the main avenue ( 2 roads , 2 tramway lines , and again 2 roads); hopefully the hotel can send a person to park , take your car , but its not so practical; you must plan your departure before...concerning…

The staff was welcoming- very helpful too. The room was modern, spotless and decently sized. It's only a ten minute walk to the center with three shopping malls along the way. The beds were comfortable and have ample pillows. The one drawback we found common in parts of Europe is a lack of air conditioning but the window opened so we were fine.

This is one of the more recent hotels built in Wroclaw and is very modern in design. The hotel is situated a little to the south of the city centre (about a 15 minute walk to the city's main squares, similar to train station). There is a tram stop right outside that connects to most places in the city. There is not much in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, but within a 5 minute walk there are many restaurants and bars. Rooms are very comfortable with free wifi. The rooms are adequate in size, not oversized by any means. Beds are comfortable and there is the usual range of international news stations on TV. I didn't eat in the hotel, but it looked to be busy most nights. Staff have good English and are very helpful. No real qualms with this hotel. Good value for the room…

I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. After reading nice reviews I decided to try out this hotel on my next trip to Wroclaw. Pro: Rooms are nice with Tea, Coffee making facility, fast wifi internet. Big TV. It is new, clean and very good value for money. It is 5 minutes walking distance from the Arkadia Mall. Hotel is Non smoking which is great. Contra: The choice of TV channels is limited. Breakfast is very expensive. Choice of Food for Room Service is very limited. Staff can be more communicative and friendly.

If you find yourself in Wroclaw, stay here. You are about a ten minute walk from the historic centre and only a couple minutes to the major highways by car. The reception staff are fluent in many languages and VERY helpful. We were most impressed with the breakfast / restaurant staff. They were very efficient, friendly and incredibly attentive. They actually seemed to care about us which is not the feeling you get from hotel staff in most places. The breakfast itself was of very high quality and offered a tremendous amount if choice. I travel a lot for business and on family holidays. This was truly one of the best quality hotels I've stayed in with one of the best staff I've ever encountered.

We stayed for a week at the Q Plus in June. We had a wonderful experience. While the room was somewhat small, it was very clean, modern and well-designed with a very large window overlooking the garden or street. There is a tram station just putside the hotel, but our street-side room was so quiet that we did'n't hear a sound. The staff was exceptionally helpful and welcoming - both front desk and restaurant staff. The breakfast buffet was one of the best we have experienced in Poland. It's setting in the bright, spacious, modern dining room with its walls of windows in each end made for a great start to each day. Further, the restaurant was superb...inventive modern Polish cuisine. Be sureto take advantage of the exercise room on the 7th floor...the views of the city are…

Definitely a stylish hotel, the facilities are nice, the room was comfortable and clean. Best of all, the breakfast, you can not miss it. My suitcase did not arrive from the airport, so I went to the shoping mall that is close, so I think this hotel has good location as well.

I enjoyed my stay here. Staff were very helpful, breakfast selection was superb and it is walking distance to the centre of town. However my room was noisy, I could easily hear the trams going past. Overall very good.

We spent 2 nights only at the Best Western Plus Q Hotel choosing not to try its (probably excellent but a tad expensive - 10 Euros per person) breakfast. The place was alright and - as other reviewers mentioned - it looked like they fixed up all the tiny issues they might have had when they opened. Despite our room facing a main road, my partner told me that she never slept so well in a hotel before so if you're light sleeper this is a big plus. The dimensions of the room were just perfect and the bathroom spotlessly clean. There are a mini-fridge, a security box and iron & ironboard if you need them. The free wifi always worked well. A nice touch are the two complimentary bottles of mineral water you'll find waiting for you every day. This hotel might look a bit far from…

Very nice and friendly staff. Fresh and clean, modern design, decent prize. Excellent and prompt service. Breakfast was a treat! Nice beds but a little stuff. Location close to the city center. I will choose this hotel if going here again! Annie Ahlberg

Brand new hotel as of May 2014; now past the early teething troubles it is very clean, well equipped and good quality for the price. Rooms are good quality and as you would expect for a new city hotel. Breakfast was very good, wide range on offer and well maintained by the staff. 4 of us arrived at 10.30pm tired and hungry; although the restaurant was meant to be closing, they were only to pleased to stay open for us until well past midnight. Only points to be aware of - underground car park is VERY tight on space. And there are lots of TV channels from all countries in Europe - but none in English. Overall, would definitely stay again.

This is a brand new hotel in Wroclaw, only opened on 1 May 2013.We were among the first guests. Staff and service are all superb and from reception to restaurant couldn't do enough for you which helped overcome some teething problems like no hot water on 2 mornings, no license through for bar but they gave complimentary beer and wine. The location is a bit further out from main square than some may like but only a 15 minute walk and tram line right outside door.Trams are very easy to use and you can go any where in city. We could recommend city tour on golf type buggy,river cruise and Japanese garden at Centennial hall and fountains .
